title: AN ACT PROVIDING FOR GOVERNMENT FINANCIAL INSTITUTIONS UNIFIED INITIATIVES TO DISTRESSED ENTERPRISES FOR ECONOMIC RECOVERY (GUIDE)
abstract: Seeks to strengthen the capacity of Land Bank of the Phils. and the Development Bank of the Phils. to provide the needed assistance to micro, small, and medium enterprises (MSMEs), and other strategically important companies; Proposes to mandate that these GFIs expand their credit and rediscounting facilities to affected MSMEs in the agriculture, infrastructure, manufacturing, and service industries; Aims to create a special holding company to be a major player in the financial and capital markets by providing aid to strategically important companies with solvency/liquidity issues brought about by the COVID-19 pandemic and mandating LBP and DBP to maintain at least majority ownership over such SHC until they have recovered their investment.
status: REFERRAL TO THE COMMITTEE ON BANKS AND FINANCIAL INTERMEDIARIES ON 2022-07-26

title: AN ACT INSTITUTING THE MEDICAL RESERVE CORPS AND APPROPRIATING FUNDS THEREFOR
abstract: Aims to produce and call on the needed manpower to expand the country's human health resources in times of disasters and public health emergencies through the mobilization of a medical reserve force fully trained to supplement the existing health care system; Propose to include in the Medical Reserve Corps, licensed physicians (retired/non-practitioners in a hospital setting); medical students who have completed their first four years of their course, graduates of medicine, and registered nurses with a limited and special authorization to render medical services pursuant to the Medical Act; and Licensed allied health professionals.
status: REFERRAL TO THE COMMITTEE ON HEALTH ON 2022-07-26

title: AN ACT INSTITUTIONALIZING THE TRANSITION OF THE GOVERNMENT TO E-GOVERNANCE IN THE DIGITAL AGE, APPROPRIATING FUNDS THEREFOR, AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES
abstract: Seeks to establish an integrated, interconnected, and interoperable information, resource sharing, and communications network through several provisions enumerated and discussed in this Act regarding the following: the Role of the DICT; the Integrated Government Network (re: paper-based workflows, etc.); the Phil. individual Information Database and Civil Registration System; the Public Service Directory; the Service Portal for Individuals and Business (government frontline services, online payment system, citizen's concerns center, cooperation of government agencies and LGUs, etc.); the Online Public Service; the Phil. Citizen Connect Program (free internet access for the public, provision of internet-capable devices in all barangays; the Government Websites and E-Bulletin Boards; Data Information Security; Phil. Infrastructure Management Corp.(PIMC); and the ICT Academy.
status: REFERRAL TO THE COMMITTEE ON INFORMATION AND COMMUNICATIONS TECHNOLOGY ON 2022-07-26

title: AN ACT PROMOTING OPEN ACCESS IN DATA TRANSMISSION AND PROVIDING ADDITIONAL POWERS TO THE NATIONAL TELECOMMUNICATIONS COMMISSION
shortTitle: Open Access In Data Transmission Act
abstract: Seeks to promote the construction and development of reliable, affordable, open, and accessible data networks that transmit fast and quality information; Proposes to create an environment within the data transmission industry that is conducive to open, fair and innovation-propelled competition; Mandates interconnection among data transmission participants to avoid dominance by a single player or by a group of data providers; Intends to clarify the role of the National Telecommunications Commission to maximize the utilization of radio spectrum resources in the allocation and assignments of finite resources in the transmission of data; Provides NTC additional power to promote a more conducive environment for data networks.

title: AN ACT CREATING A SUSTAINABLE FISCAL FRAMEWORK FOR THE PENSION SYSTEM OF THE MILITARY AND UNIFORMED PERSONNEL, PROVIDING MECHANISMS FOR THE DISPOSITION OF GOVERNMENT ASSETS FOR THE PURPOSE, AND APPROPRIATING FUNDS THEREFOR
abstract: Declares that the State shall ensure that there shall be an adequate, robust, and well-managed insurance system that shall adequately and sustainably support the needs of the military and uniformed personnel and their dependents; Proposes reforms to address several long-standing issues in the design of the MUP system related to the following: disability pension, mandatory contributions, fund administrator of MUP pension, pension indexation, other sources of funding, and tax treatment of the MUP Trust Fund.
status: SECONDARILY REFERRED TO THE COMMITTEE(S) ON PUBLIC ORDER AND SAFETY

title: AN ACT PROVIDING FOR THE MODERNIZATION OF THE PUBLIC HEALTH EMERGENCY PREPAREDNESS AND RESPONSE CAPABILITIES, ESTABLISHING FOR THIS PURPOSE THE CENTER FOR DISEASE PREVENTION AND CONTROL, AND APPROPRIATING FUNDS THEREFOR
abstract: Proposes among several others, the transfer of DOH units and functions to the CDC of the following:  Epidemiology Bureau, Research Institute for Tropical Medicine, Sexually Transmitted Disease - AIDS Cooperative Central Laboratory, selected functions of the International Health Surveillance Division of the Bureau of Quarantine, technical and standard-setting functions of the Disease Prevention and Control Bureau including that of the Mental Health Division, Cancer Division and Oral Health Division.
status: REFERRAL TO THE COMMITTEE ON HEALTH ON 2022-07-26

title: AN ACT ESTABLISHING THE PHILIPPINE VIROLOGY SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY INSTITUTE AND APPROPRIATING FUNDS THEREFOR
abstract: Seeks to conduct an in-depth studies on viruses and their potential disease-causing agents that affect people, plants, and animals in order to provide scientific bases for the treatment of viral diseases; Proposes to create the VIP as the premier research Institute in the field of virology which shall be a venue for scientists, research institutes, and other organizations to work collaboratively to study viruses of agricultural, industrial, clinical, and environmental importance.
status: SECONDARILY REFERRED TO THE COMMITTEE(S) ON SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY

title: AN ACT TO FURTHER DEVELOP CAPABILITY AND ESTABLISH EXPEDITIOUS TRANSFORMATION OF THE DEPARTMENT OF NATIONAL DEFENSE AND ITS BUREAUS, APPROPRIATING FUNDS THEREFOR AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES
abstract: Seeks to provide a mechanism for the coordination of departments and agencies in addressing multi-dimensional facet of national defense and security, and to achieve a common understanding of its issues by providing the facility for consensus building and consultation processes; Proposes several provisions among others regarding: mandatory military service; the National Defense Council which mandates DND to exercise supervision and control over the AFP, Government Arsenal, Office of Civil Defense, Phil. Veterans Affairs Office (PVAO) and the National Defense University of the Phils.; management and control of defense real properties; functions of the Phil. Army, Phil. Air Force, and Phil. Navy; Women's Auxiliary Corps; Phil. Military Academy.
status: REFERRAL TO THE COMMITTEE ON NATIONAL DEFENSE AND SECURITY ON 2022-07-26

title: AN ACT RIGHTSIZING THE NATIONAL GOVERNMENT TO IMPROVE PUBLIC SERVICE DELIVERY
abstract: Aims to improve public service delivery by minimizing duplication, redundancy, or overlapping in functions through designing an organizational structure that shall function effectively in the context of good governance and fiscal prudence; Intends to authorize the President to rightsize the Executive Branch while the Legislative, the Judiciary, the Constitutional Commissions, may likewise rightsize their respective offices; local Government Units may also rightsize their respective offices, subject to their financial capability while the Governance Commission for GOCCs (GCG) shall continue to exercise its authority under R.A. No. 10149.
status: REFERRAL TO THE COMMITTEE ON GOVERNMENT REORGANIZATION ON 2022-07-26

title: AN ACT CREATING THE DEPARTMENT OF DISASTER RESILIENCE, DEFINING ITS MANDATE, POWERS AND FUNCTIONS, AND APPROPRIATING FUNDS THEREFOR
abstract: Proposes to create a Department that will have a full-time focus on natural hazards and disasters, which is characterized by unity of command, a science and ICT-based approach, and the capacity to take charge of three key result areas: disaster risk reduction; disaster preparedness, and response; and recovery, rehabilitation and building forward better;Provides among others, some key elements and features of the proposed Department regarding the take-over capacity of any private utility; rationalized fund-use and fast and responsive procurement; highly specialized functions, and highly-skilled personnel requirements (scientists, environmental and/or urban planners, civil engineers, and public finance specialist); and institutional partnership with LGUs, NGOs, and academia.
status: SECONDARILY REFERRED TO THE COMMITTEE(S) ON DISASTER RESILIENCE

title: AN ACT ESTABLISHING EVACUATION CENTERS IN EVERY CITY AND MUNICIPALITY, AND APPROPRIATING FUNDS THEREFOR
abstract: Aims to establish a standard-based evacuation centers to decongest public schools and private facilities evacuation centers which shall be a permanent recourse in times of calamities and natural or man-made disasters such as typhoons, floods, storm surges, drought and other severe climate disturbances, as well as fire and the outbreak of illnesses and diseases.Provides for the following provisions: minimum requirements for every evacuation center such as location designation, structural and building capacity, amenities and accessibility; the role of the National Disaster Risk Reduction and Management Council (NDRRMC); and for the coordination with the DPWH and the DOST with regard to the design specifications, cost estimates, and construction details.
status: REFERRAL TO THE COMMITTEE ON DISASTER RESILIENCE ON 2022-07-26

title: AN ACT PROMOTING THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE PHILIPPINE DOWNSTREAM NATURAL GAS INDUSTRY, CONSOLIDATING FOR THE PURPOSE ALL LAWS RELATING TO THE TRANSMISSION, DISTRIBUTION AND SUPPLY OF NATURAL GAS, AND APPROPRIATING FUNDS THEREFOR
abstract: Provides for several key provisions among others as follows:  mandate the Department of Energy to be the lead agency responsible for the supervision and monitoring of the Industry and the regulation of the construction and operation of natural gas pipelines and related facilities for the transmission, distribution, and supply of natural gas; stipulates that the Energy Regulatory Commission shall have the sole regulatory responsibility for establishing the rates and related terms and conditions of service for the transmission and distribution, regasification and supply of natural gas; states the powers and responsibilities of the DENR, DOH, DTI (Bureau of Phil. Standards), and the Philippine Competition Commission (PCC).
status: REFERRAL TO THE COMMITTEE ON ENERGY ON 2022-07-26
